answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a number of articles and discussions which may help offer you a start. 
This article discusses how City of Rancho Cucamonga, CA used private contracting to overhaul the sidewalks in their community.
http://icma.org/en/Article/101000/Filling_in_the_Gaps_City_of_Rancho_Cucamonga_Conducts_Inventory_of_Missing_Sidewalks
This article describes how Mount Healthy, OH outsourced some of their IT support offices.
http://icma.org/en/Article/10458/NextStep_Networking_Inc_Announces_a_One_Year_Outsourcing_Contract
This report discusses the best ways of a creating a competitive privatization process in your community.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5159/A_Blueprint_for_Privatization_and_Competition
In this article you can learn more about managing high risk outsourcing options and how to avoid them.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2444/Managing_HighRisk_Outsourcing
I have also included links to a number of Knowledge Network questions which were previously asked and answered about privatizing different responsibilities. 
This question discusses options for privatizing waste management.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20780/Example_cities_that_have_privatized_trash_pickup
Parks Maintenance
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20022/Privatization_of_Parks_Maintenance
Snow Removal http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20905/Contracting_Out_Snow_Removal
Also these two questions cover in general where to begin when looking for the best ways to outsource various tasks.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/21098/Determining_Which_Services_to_Review_First__Outsourcing
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20408/Outsourcing_Policies
Finally, this article includes a summary of a number of communities and their experiences with contracting and service delivery.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/100022/ICMA_Profile_of_Local_Government_Service_Delivery_Choices_2007
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: William Gilmore
answers.text:
Larry,
A possible consideration for you to consider is performing a SWOT (strength, weaknesses, opportunities and Threats) exercise on specific services be looked at for privatization.  I led one with the City of Tisbury, MA to identify issues that could help them be more efficient, look at how they were using their facilities, evaluating technology use, and so on.  We had all the department heads meet with and without management to walk through this process.  It was very useful.  This information could then be used as the basis for a broader meeting with the larger community interest groups selected to participate in an integrated planning exercise that looks at the same service(s) and creates a vision, mission statement, service expectation and what can be done differently under a privatized strategy that can't be done internally.  Many times you find ways to fix what you have that offsets the need to privatize.  Sometimes the results justify the need to move forward.

author: Larry Arnold
text:
What processes for reviewing potential privatization or outsourcing of municipal services have been successfully used in your community? Trying to find, or establish best practice(s) in terms of involving employees, business and civic/neighborhood organizations, special interest groups, general citizenry community and policy makers.
Areas of consideration could range from solid waste where the practice is more common to fire/EMS service.
title: Privatization - Internal and External Review Process
